intro: Pulassarium halmaheirae, commonly known as the Halmahera pulassarium, is a rare flowering plant native to the island of Halmahera in Indonesia. It belongs to the family Meliaceae, which includes mahogany and related trees. The plant is characterized by its small, delicate leaves and unique, fragrant flowers that bloom in clusters. It thrives in humid, shaded environments within tropical rainforests. Due to habitat loss, it is considered endangered and requires conservation efforts to ensure its survival.
